tuv.seg: In Ireland, instead of arresting you to bring you to court to answer a complaint, the Gardaí (Irish police force) may serve you with a summons ordering you to appear in court on a particular date at a particular time

In Éirinn, in áit tú a ghabháil chun tú a thabhairt chun na cúirte chun gearán a fhreagairt, is féidir leis na Gardaí toghairm a sheirbheáil ort a ordaíonn duit a theacht i láthair sa chúirt ar dháta ar leith ag am ar leith
Summonses are issued by the District Court after a complaint has been made against you by a Garda (or someone else in a private prosecution)
Eisíonn an Chúirt Dúiche toghairmeacha tar éis do ghearán a bheith déanta i do choinne ag Garda (nó ag duine eile in ionchúiseamh príobháideach)
Usually, summonses are issued in less serious cases where it is not considered necessary to arrest you to guarantee your appearance in court
Is iondúil go n-eisítear toghairmeacha i gcásanna nach bhfuil chomh tromchúiseach nuair nach gceaptar gur gá tú a ghabháil chun a chinntiú go dtiocfaidh tú i láthair sa chúirt
There are three ways in which summonses can be issued in Ireland for minor offences:
Tá trí bhealach inar féidir toghairmeacha a eisiúint in Éirinn i gcomhair mionchionta:
• Under Section 10 of the Petty Sessions (Ireland) Act 1851
• Faoi Alt 10 den Acht Gearr-Sheisiún (Éire) 1851
• Under an administrative process introduced by Section 1 of the Courts (No
• Faoi phróiseas riaracháin a tugadh isteach faoi Alt 1 den Acht na gCúirteanna (Uimh
• Under the process for non-payment of fixed charge fines
• Faoin bpróiseas i gcomhair neamh-íocaíocht ar fhíneálacha ráta seasta
Under the Petty Sessions (Ireland) Act 1851
Faoin Acht Gearr-Sheisiún (Éire) 1851
This is the process that is usually used in private prosecutions where, for example, individuals are having difficulties with neighbours
Seo é an próiseas a úsáidtear go hiondúil in ionchúisimh príobháideacha, mar shampla, sa chás ina bhfuil deacrachtaí ag daoine aonair lena gcuid comharsana
It is rarely used by the Gardaí
Ní minic a úsáideann na Gardaí é
The complainant goes before a District Court judge and makes the complaint either orally or in writing, with or without an oath, as the judge decides
Téann an gearánach os comhair breitheamh Cúirte Dúiche agus déanann sé an gearán ó bhéal nó i scríbhinn, le nó gan mionn, de réir mar a shocraíonn an breitheamh
The information the complainant provides should contain brief particulars of:
Ba cheart mionsonraí a bheith i gceist sa bhfaisnéis a thugann an gearánach maidir le:
• Name and address of the alleged offender
• Ainm agus seoladh an té a bhfuil an cion curtha ina leith
• Name and address of the complaintant
• Ainm agus seoladh an ghearánaí
• The basic facts of the alleged offence, including when it is alleged to have been committed
• Na sonraí bunúsacha a bhaineann leis an gcion líomhnaithe, lena n-áirítear an t-am atá sé líomhnaithe a tharla sé
• If possible the piece of legislation which applies to the offence
• An píosa reachtaíochta a bhaineann leis an gcion, más féidir
When the information has been put before the judge, he/she must decide whether it justifies a summons
Nuair a chuirtear an fhaisnéis ós comhair an bhreitheamh, ní mór dó/di an cinneadh a dhéanamh an dtugann sé údar le toghairm
If the judge issues a summons it will require the alleged offender to appear at a sitting of the court
Má eisíonn an breitheamh toghairm, cuirfidh sé seo ceangailt ar an té a bhfuil an cion curtha ina leith
Under the Courts (No
Faoi Acht na gCúirteanna (Uimh
The administrative process under the Courts (No. 3) Act 1986 is the procedure usually used by the Gardaí and allows for summonses to be issued by the office of the District Court
Is é an próiseas riaracháin foi Acht na gCúirteanna (Uimh 3) 1986 an nós imeachta a úsáideann na Gardaí go hiondúil agus ceadaíonn sé seo do oifig na Cúirte Dúiche toghairmeacha a eisiúint

This is an administrative process where applications can be made on behalf of the Attorney General, the Director of Public Prosecutions, a member of the Garda Siochana or any other person statutorily authorised to prosecute offences

Is próiseas riaracháin é seo inar féidir iarratais a dhéanamh ar son an Ard-Aighne, an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí, baill den Gharda Síochána nó aon duine eile atá cead reachtúil acu cionta a ionchúiseamh
A summons issued under the 1851 Act or issued under the 1986 Act must contain the following:
Toghairm a eiseofar faoin Act 1851 nó a eisíodh faoi Acht 1986 ní mór do na nithe seo a leanas a bheith san toghairm:
• The name of the complaintant or prosecutor (for example, a Garda’s name)
• Ainm an ghearánaí nó an ionchúisitheoir (mar shampla, ainm Gharda)
• The name and address of the person against whom the complaint is made
• Ainm agus seoladh an té ina bhfuil an gearán déanta ina leith
• Details, in ordinary language, of the alleged offence including the time, date and place of the alleged offence
• Sonraí, i ngnáth-theanga, maidir leis an gcion líomhnaithe, lena n-áirítear an t-am, an dáta agus an suíomh inar tharla an cion líomhnaithe
• The date, time and venue of the court
• Am, dáta agus ionad na cúirte
• The judge's signature if issued by a judge or the name of the District Court clerk
• An bhreithimh síniú má eisiúint ag breitheamh nó ainm an gcléireach Cúirte Dúiche
Where the summons is issued under the 1986 Act the summons also contains:
Sa chás ina n-eisítear an toghairm faoi Acht 1986, bíonn na nithe seo a leanas san toghairm freisin:
• An outline of the law that is alleged to have been broken
• breac-chuntas ar an dlí atá sé líomhnaithe a briseadh
• The date on which the summons was applied for
• An dáta ar a ndearnadh iarratas ar an toghairm
This final one is most important in relation to the time limits for commencement of criminal proceedings
Is é an ceann deiridh seo é an ceann is tábhachtaí maidir leis na teorainneacha ama i leith tús a chur le himeachtaí coiriúla
This date will indicate if the summons was applied for within the legal time limit for instituting proceedings
Léireoidh an dáta seo ar cuireadh isteach ar an toghairm taobh istigh den teorainn ama dlíthiúil atá ann chun tús a chur le himeachtaí
For non-payment of fixed charge fines
I gcomhair neamh-íocaíocht fhíneálacha ráta seasta
When you are issued with a fixed charge notice for a road traffic offence and you fail to pay the fine within the time allowed, a summons is automatically issued and sent to you by ordinary post

Nuair a eisítear fógra ráta seasta chugat i gcomhair cion trácht ar bhóithre agus go dteipeann ort an fíneáil a íoc taobh istigh den am atá ceadaithe, eisítear toghairm chugat go huathoibríoch agus seolfar chugat é sa ghnáth-phost
This process does not require a Garda to apply for the summons to be issued, because the summons is triggered by non-payment of the fixed charge fine
Ní gá sa phróiseas seo go ndéanfadh an Garda iarratas go n-eiseofaí an toghairm, mar tarlaíonn an toghairm mar thoradh ar neamh-íocaíocht an fhíneáil ráta seasta
Service of the summons
An toghairm a sheirbheáil
The rules which govern the service of summonses are to be found in the Rules of the District Court (Order 10)
Tá fáil ar na rialacha a rialaíonn seirbheáil toghairmeacha in Rialacha na Cúirte Dúiche (Ordú 10)
Basically a summons can be served on you in the following ways:
Go bunúsach, is féidir toghairm a sheirbheáil ort sna bealaí seo a leanas:
• Personal delivery: by handing a copy of the summons to you or by leaving it at your last known abode or your place of work, or with your spouse, child or other relative
• Seachadadh pearsanta: trí chóip den toghairm a shíneadh chugat nó é a fhágáil ag an áit chónaithe is déanaí is eol duit nó do áit oibre, le do chéile, do leanbh nó gaol eile
• Postal delivery: by registered post to your last or most usual place of abode or to your place of business or employment
• Seachadadh sa phost: trí post cláraithe chuig do áit chónaithe is déanaí nó is iondúil duit nó chuig do áit gnó nó an áit ina bhfuil tú fostaithe
Where service is affected by personal delivery, the summons must be served at least 7 days before the date fixed for your court case
Nuair atá seirbheáil á dhéanamh trí sheachadadh pearsanta, ní mór don toghairm a bheith seirbheáilte ar a laghad 7 lá roimh an dáta atá socraithe dod' chás cúirte
In the case of registered post, the period is 21 days
I gcás phost cláraithe, is tréimhse 21 lá atá i gceist
If a summons has not been correctly served, you are not obliged to appear in court in response to it
Murar seirbheáladh toghairm i gceart, níl aon iachall ort a theacht i láthair sa chúirt mar fhreagra air
However, if you are present in court, there is no reason why the proceedings against you cannot proceed
Má tá tú i láthair sa chúirt, áfach, níl aon chúis nach féidir leis na himeachtaí i do choinne dul chun cinn
In other words, any defect in the service of the summons is corrected by your appearance in court
I bhfocail eile, tá aon locht a bhí ar sheirbheáil na toghairme arna cheartú ag do láithreas sa chúirt
Defects or errors on the summons
Lochtanna nó dearmadaí ar an toghairm
It is rare that a court dismisses a case on the basis of an error or omission in a summons
Is fíor-annamh a dhíbhíonn an chúirt cás mar gheall ar dhearmad nó easnamh i dtoghairm

Discrepancies or differences, between the facts on the summons and the facts presented to the court by the prosecuting Garda concerning time and place of the incident, does not normally prevent the prosecution of the case

Ní iondúil go gcosctar ionchúiseamh an cháis mar thoradh ar neamhréiteach nó difríochtaí idir na fíorais ar an toghairm agus na fíorais a chuireann an Garda atá i mbun an ionchúisimh i láthair na cúirte maidir le ham agus áit an eachtra
In fact, the District Court has discretion to amend a defective summons under Rule 38 of the Distric Court Rules
Go deimhin, tá sé de dhiscréid ag an gCúirt Dúiche toghairm lochtach a leasú
If you do not appear in court on the date stated in the summons, the District Court may either:
Mura dtagann tú i láthair sa chúirt ar an dáta atá sonraithe ar an toghairm, is féidir leis an gCúirt Dúiche:
• Go ahead with the hearing in your absence or
• Dul ar aghaidh leis an éisteacht i d'uireasa nó
• Decide to adjourn the matter
• Cinneadh a dhéanamh an ábhar a chur ar atráth
